alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 5:53AM PDT until April 01 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Mostly above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations between 12 and 24 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph on exposed mountain ridges. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Stehekin, and Holden Village. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Motorists traveling on US Highway 2 should be prepared for winter driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The late season sun angle will contribute to higher accumulation efficiency for snow that falls overnight and early in the morning. Snowfall rates up to an inch per hour and falling temperatures Friday night will create winter driving conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
